study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a cool damp washcloth with peppermint essential oil was more effective than a cool damp washcloth alone in reducing self-reported nausea intensity in chemotherapy patients.
results_summary: The study found that peppermint oil significantly decreased the intensity of chemotherapy-induced nausea compared to a cool washcloth alone. The results suggest peppermint oil is an effective intervention for nausea relief in this setting.
population_specificity: 79 adult chemotherapy patients from an outpatient ambulatory infusion center in the southeastern United States.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of peppermint, in combination with other agents, on endoscopic visualization during esophagogastroduodenoscopy (EGD).
results_summary: The study found that the combination of simethicone, NAC, sodium bicarbonate, and peppermint (Group D) resulted in the lowest total visibility score (TVS), indicating improved endoscopic visualization compared to other groups. The procedural duration and volume of mucosal cleansing solution were also reduced in Group D.
population_specificity: 128 patients undergoing upper gastrointestinal endoscopy (EGD).
effective_dosage: Not specified (peppermint was part of a combination regimen).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of inhaling peppermint essence on pain and anxiety caused by intravenous catheterization in cardiac patients.
results_summary: Peppermint aromatherapy significantly reduced pain compared to the control group, but while anxiety levels decreased significantly within each group, there was no significant difference between the groups. The study concluded that peppermint aromatherapy attenuated both pain and anxiety from catheterization.
population_specificity: 80 cardiac patients undergoing intravenous catheterization.
effective_dosage: Not specified (inhaled aromatherapy with peppermint essence).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of peppermint gel on preventing pressure injuries in head trauma patients admitted to neurosurgical ICUs.
results_summary: The study found that peppermint gel significantly reduced the incidence of pressure injuries (22.8% in the intervention group vs. 77% in the control group), with the sacrum being the most common site for injuries. The difference between groups was statistically significant (P < 0.001).
population_specificity: Patients with head trauma admitted to neurosurgical ICUs in Iran.
effective_dosage: Peppermint gel applied three times daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of a combination of peppermint oil and caraway oil (POCO) compared with placebo in treating patients with functional dyspepsia (FD).
results_summary: POCO showed statistically significant improvement in global FD symptoms and epigastric pain, with no significant differences in adverse events compared to placebo. However, the findings are based on smaller sample sizes and low/very low-quality evidence.
population_specificity: Patients with functional dyspepsia (FD) (578 participants across 5 RCTs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of small-intestinal-release and ileocolonic-release peppermint oil in treating IBS symptoms, using FDA/EMA-recommended endpoints.
results_summary: The study found no statistically significant improvements in abdominal pain response or overall symptom relief for either peppermint oil formulation compared to placebo, though small-intestinal-release peppermint oil showed significant improvements in secondary outcomes like abdominal pain, discomfort, and IBS severity. Adverse events were mild but more common in peppermint oil groups.
population_specificity: 190 patients with IBS (Rome IV criteria), predominantly female (77.8%), mean age 34.0 years, from 4 Dutch hospitals.
effective_dosage: 182 mg (small-intestinal-release or ileocolonic-release peppermint oil) daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of intranasal peppermint essential oil (1.5%) versus lidocaine (4%) and placebo in reducing migraine headache intensity and frequency.
results_summary: Peppermint oil significantly reduced headache intensity in 42.1% of patients, comparable to lidocaine (41.5%), and outperformed placebo. The nasal application of peppermint oil was effective in relieving migraine pain similarly to lidocaine.
population_specificity: 120 adult migraine patients (diagnosed per International Headache Society criteria).
effective_dosage: 1.5% peppermint essential oil drops, administered intranasally (second dose if needed after 15 minutes).
study_duration: Symptoms assessed at 5, 15, and 30 minutes post-administration; follow-up after 2 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if topical peppermint oil reduces colonic spasticity and improves visualization during screening colonoscopy.
results_summary: Peppermint oil reduced bowel spasticity and shortened colonoscopy time, but improvements in adenoma detection rate and bowel visibility were not statistically significant.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing screening colonoscopy.
effective_dosage: 50 mL of peppermint oil solution administered once during colonoscopy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of 10% and 30% peppermint essential oil aromatherapy on the severity of nausea in surgical patients.
results_summary: Both 10% and 30% peppermint essential oils significantly reduced nausea severity in surgical patients, with no significant difference between the two concentrations. The control group showed no statistically significant change in nausea severity.
population_specificity: 120 patients undergoing abdominal surgery at Imam Reza Hospital in Kermanshah, Iran.
effective_dosage: 0.2 ml of 10% or 30% peppermint essential oil inhaled once.
study_duration: Single intervention with measurements taken before and 10 minutes after inhalation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the suppressive effects of peppermint extracts, specifically pheophorbide a, on CYP3A4 gene expression induced by rifampicin in HepG2 cells.
results_summary: The study found that pheophorbide a from peppermint suppressed CYP3A4 mRNA expression in a dose-dependent manner, with a high safety margin due to its low effective dose. However, pheophorbide a is known to cause photosensitivity.
population_specificity: HepG2 cells (a human liver cell line) treated with rifampicin.
effective_dosage: 0.43 mg of pheophorbide a per 2 g of dry leaves (equivalent to one cup of peppermint tea).
interactions: Suppression of CYP3A4 induction by rifampicin, indicating potential drug-herb interaction.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of dietary peppermint leaves and menthol on broiler chicks' performance, survivability, meat quality, and carcass characteristics.
results_summary: Peppermint and menthol supplementation improved body weight, feed intake, feed conversion, and reduced mortality and abdominal fat percentage, without affecting meat pH or drip loss.
population_specificity: 1-day-old Ross 308 broiler chicks
effective_dosage: Peppermint leaves at 0, 5, 10, or 15 g/kg diet; menthol at 0, 26, 52, or 78 mg/kg diet

study_goal: To explore the impact of peppermint oil on dysphagia and/or chest pain in patients referred for motility testing.
results_summary: 63% of patients reported improvement (24 out of 38), with the best responses seen in those with distal esophageal spasm (83%) and esophagogastric junction outflow obstruction (100%). No patients reported feeling worse.
population_specificity: Patients with dysphagia and/or chest pain referred for motility testing, excluding those with obstructing esophageal lesions, lost to follow-up, or preexisting cardiac conditions.
effective_dosage: Two commercially available dissolvable peppermint tablets before meals for dysphagia, as-needed for chest pain.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether omeprazole could enhance peppermint's tolerance to water stress and improve its growth, essential oil composition, and related biochemical markers.
results_summary: Higher doses of omeprazole improved peppermint's growth, chlorophyll and proline levels, gas exchange, enzyme activity, and essential oil composition under both normal and water-stressed conditions. The treatment also upregulated genes in the menthol biosynthesis pathway.
population_specificity: Peppermint plants (Mentha piperita) subjected to varying water stress levels (100%, 70%, and 50% of container substrate capacity).
effective_dosage: Weekly drenching applications of 0, 10, 50, 100, or 200 μM omeprazole.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of Aloe vera-Peppermint (Veramin) moisturizing gel on mouth dryness and oral health in ICU patients.
results_summary: The study found that Veramin gel significantly reduced mouth dryness and improved oral health compared to placebo, with statistically significant results by the 5th day of use.
population_specificity: Patients hospitalized in Intensive Care Units (ICUs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of peppermint oil on global symptoms and abdominal pain in patients with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).
results_summary: Peppermint oil significantly improved global IBS symptoms (RR 2.39) and abdominal pain (RR 1.78) compared to placebo, with no significant difference in adverse effects between groups. The number needed to treat was three for global symptoms and four for abdominal pain.
population_specificity: Adults with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether inhaled peppermint essential oil improves lung function (measured via spirometry) and whether perceived effects align with objective measurements.
results_summary: The study found that peppermint essential oil had no significant impact on spirometric variables (e.g., forced vital capacity, peak expiratory flow). Participants' subjective perceptions of improvement were influenced by expectations but did not correlate with actual measured changes.
population_specificity: 106 healthy participants
effective_dosage: Nebulized peppermint essential oil for 15 minutes (specific concentration not stated)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the pharmacokinetic parameters of small intestinal release peppermint oil (SI-PO) and a novel ileocolonic release peppermint oil (IC-PO) to determine if IC-PO enhances colonic exposure.
results_summary: IC-PO showed significantly delayed peak menthol glucuronide concentration and lag time compared to SI-PO, suggesting release in the distal intestine. No significant differences were found in peak concentrations or elimination half-lives, but IC-PO's delayed release may enhance therapeutic efficacy for colonic conditions.
population_specificity: Eight healthy volunteers (50% female, median age 22).
effective_dosage: 182 mg of either SI-PO or IC-PO in a crossover design.
study_duration: Single administration with a washout period of more than 14 days.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of peppermint oil aromatherapy on the severity of nausea and vomiting in pregnant women.
results_summary: Both peppermint oil and placebo groups showed significant reductions in nausea and vomiting severity, but there was no statistically significant difference between the two groups, suggesting similar effects. The similarity may be due to psychological impacts of the intervention.
population_specificity: 56 pregnant women with mild to moderate nausea and vomiting, aged 6 to 20 weeks gestation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the literature on peppermint oil's metabolism, effects on gastrointestinal physiology, clinical efficacy, and safety.
results_summary: Peppermint oil demonstrated multiple mechanisms of action, including smooth muscle relaxation and visceral sensitivity modulation, and was effective in treating irritable bowel syndrome, functional dyspepsia, childhood functional abdominal pain, and post-operative nausea with few reported adverse effects.
population_specificity: General gastrointestinal disorder patients, including those with irritable bowel syndrome, functional dyspepsia, and post-operative nausea.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a method for encapsulating peppermint oil in starch nanoparticles to enhance its stability and slow-release properties.
results_summary: The study successfully fabricated peppermint oil-loaded starch nanoparticles with high encapsulation efficiency (~87.7%) and yield (~93.2%), demonstrating enhanced thermal stability and controlled release kinetics.
population_specificity: Not applicable (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential antidiabetic effects of peppermint essential oil (PEO) in streptozotocin and nicotinamide-induced diabetic rats.
results_summary: PEO treatment reduced blood glucose levels, increased serum insulin and C-peptide levels, improved antioxidant status, and promoted regeneration of hepatic and pancreatic tissues. It also rectified diabetes-induced anemia and restored leukocyte and platelet counts.
population_specificity: Streptozotocin and nicotinamide-induced diabetic rats.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Menthacarin®, a combination of peppermint and caraway oils, could reverse visceral hypersensitivity in maternally separated rats and alter their mycobiome and microbiome.
results_summary: Menthacarin® reversed water-avoidance-induced visceral hypersensitivity in maternally separated rats and shifted their mycobiome composition. It also exhibited in vitro antifungal and antimicrobial properties.
population_specificity: Maternally separated rats (animal model).

study_goal: The researchers were examining the potential role of herbal medicines, including Peppermint, in the comprehensive therapy of upper functional dyspepsia.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings about Peppermint's effects, only mentioning that herbal medicines can play a significant role in self-treatment.
population_specificity: Not specified

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if dietary peppermint oil could improve growth and reduce aggression in blue swimmer crab juveniles.
results_summary: Peppermint oil had no effect on growth or cannibalism but caused significant histopathological changes in the hepatopancreas at levels of 0.10% and above.
population_specificity: Blue swimmer crab (Portunus pelagicus) early juveniles
study_duration: 12 days for growth measurement, followed by 10 days for cannibalism observation

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether peppermint oil aromatherapy could reduce the need for antiemetics in patients experiencing postoperative nausea and vomiting (PONV) after total knee arthroplasty under spinal anesthesia.
results_summary: Peppermint oil significantly reduced the amount of antiemetic drugs used compared to placebo, lavender, and lemon oils, though it did not significantly improve nausea and vomiting scores or patient satisfaction.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing total knee arthroplasty under spinal anesthesia who experienced postoperative nausea and vomiting.
study_duration: Administered immediately after surgery, with outcomes measured until the third postoperative day.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of peppermint oil as a first-line antispasmodic treatment for functional abdominal pain.
results_summary: Peppermint oil was identified as a first-line treatment option for functional abdominal pain, alongside other antispasmodic substances, suggesting its efficacy in managing symptoms. The abstract implies its use is supported in less severe cases, with progressive introduction based on clinical response.
population_specificity: Patients with functional abdominal pain (no specific demographic details provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of intranasal herbal medicines, including Peppermint oil, for rapid therapy by analyzing preclinical and clinical studies.
results_summary: Peppermint oil emerged as a potential candidate for intranasal therapy, with most treatments being safe and showing greater effects at lower doses compared to oral administration. The study noted that intranasal herbal treatments mainly regulate inflammation and neurotransmission.
population_specificity: Preclinical (mice, rats, rabbits) and clinical studies (human)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical data and safety profiles of peppermint for treating anxiety disorders and depression.
results_summary: The study found that currently available data do not fully support the use of peppermint for anxiety disorders and depression, indicating limited efficacy. No significant adverse effects or safety concerns were highlighted for peppermint in this context.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of clinical data)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review clinical trials evaluating the efficacy of herbal remedies, including peppermint oil, in treating chronic pruritus.
results_summary: The study found that peppermint oil was among the herbal remedies significantly effective in treating chronic pruritus, though the abstract does not provide specific details on its performance.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic pruritus (specific demographics not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether peppermint essential oil could improve physical performance (time to exhaustion) in recreational runners.
results_summary: Peppermint essential oil significantly increased time to exhaustion compared to placebo (109.9 vs. 98.5 minutes, p=0.009), but did not affect body temperature, thermal sensation, heart rate, or hydration status. The mechanisms behind the performance improvement remain unclear.
population_specificity: Fourteen male recreational runners (average age 37.1 years, BMI 24 kg/m²).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether peppermint oil caused extraintestinal symptoms in irritable bowel syndrome patients by comparing it to placebo and treatment as usual.
results_summary: The study found that extraintestinal symptoms decreased significantly in all groups, including peppermint oil, placebo, and treatment as usual, suggesting peppermint oil did not worsen symptoms. Most participants did not report new or worsened symptoms, and symptom severity improved across all groups.
population_specificity: 173 participants with irritable bowel syndrome (30 received peppermint oil, 71 placebo, 72 treatment as usual).

study_goal: The researchers were not attempting to determine anything about Peppermint; the abstract focuses on anti-neuropathic agents, dietary, pharmacological, and psychological treatments for IBS pain.
results_summary: The abstract does not mention Peppermint or its effects.
population_specificity: Patients with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the current evidence for non-pharmacological treatments, including peppermint oil, in managing IBS-D and IBS-M.
results_summary: Peppermint oil was noted as a useful adjunct therapy for IBS, though its specific effects in IBS-D/M were not described in detail. The abstract suggests it is part of complementary alternative medications (CAM) with potential benefits.
population_specificity: Subjects with IBS-D and IBS-M.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the efficacy and safety of biophenol-rich nutraceuticals, including peppermint oil, for improving gastrointestinal symptoms and quality of life in patients with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).
results_summary: Peppermint oil showed moderate to high certainty of evidence for improving gastrointestinal symptoms and quality of life in IBS patients, with no significant adverse events reported.
population_specificity: Patients with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize recent literature on natural compounds, including those from peppermint, for potential therapeutic use in Alzheimer's disease.
results_summary: The abstract highlights interest in peppermint's chemical compounds for Alzheimer's treatment but does not provide specific results on peppermint's efficacy or safety. It emphasizes phytotherapy as a reliable therapeutic method for neurodegenerative diseases.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on Alzheimer's disease).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the impact of SARS-CoV-2 infection on chemosensory function, using peppermint as a mixed olfactory-trigeminal stimulus in a flavor test.
results_summary: Peppermint was recognized by COVID-19 patients similarly to healthy controls, but the perceived intensity of its aroma was significantly lower in patients. The study suggests peppermint can be used as part of a self-administered flavor test to assess smell and taste dysfunctions in COVID-19 patients.
population_specificity: 111 subjects (19 hospitalized COVID-19 patients, 37 home-isolated COVID-19 patients, and 55 healthy controls).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore patient adherence to a smartphone app used as a symptom diary for assessing treatment response in irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).
results_summary: The study found high adherence (87.9%) to the diary app, though adherence decreased slightly over time. Higher anxiety scores were associated with lower adherence, but no other demographic factors significantly influenced adherence.
population_specificity: Patients with irritable bowel syndrome (Rome IV criteria), mean age 34.0 years, 77.8% female.

study_goal: The researchers evaluated the effectiveness of peppermint oil as a treatment option for functional abdominal pain in children.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that peppermint oil may be appropriate for managing functional abdominal pain in children, though psychological interventions have a stronger evidence base. No specific outcomes or statistical results for peppermint oil are detailed.
population_specificity: Children with functional abdominal pain.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of a topical ointment containing peppermint, aloe vera, and honey compared to petroleum jelly for dressing skin graft donor sites.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in wound healing, pain, pruritus, or discomfort between the natural ointment and petroleum jelly, but the ointment was superior in reducing erythema and improving treatment satisfaction.
population_specificity: Patients referred for split-thickness skin grafts after burns or surgical wounds on the scalp or face.
effective_dosage: Applied topically on days 0, 4, 7, and 14 (exact amount not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of peppermint oil as a treatment for functional dyspepsia in elderly patients.
results_summary: The study found that peppermint oil had limited efficacy in treating functional dyspepsia in elderly patients, with no significant clinical benefits reported.
population_specificity: Elderly patients with functional dyspepsia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare and rank the efficacy of traditional therapies, including peppermint oil, for treating irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).
results_summary: Peppermint oil capsules were ranked first for efficacy in improving global IBS symptoms (RR 0.63, 95% CI 0.48-0.83, P-score 0.84), but the study noted considerable uncertainty due to methodological limitations in some RCTs.
population_specificity: Adults (aged ≥18 years) with IBS of any subtype.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether non-deceptive open-label placebos (OLPs) involving peppermint vapor could reduce nausea compared to deceptive placebos or controls.
results_summary: The study found limited evidence for a placebo effect with peppermint vapor, and no positive evidence for open-label placebo effects in nausea. A deceptive effect was observed in VR but not with peppermint.
population_specificity: Healthy volunteers

study_goal: The researchers aimed to optimize data preprocessing protocols for detecting breath samples using compact mass spectrometry (CMS), including a peppermint washout study.
results_summary: The peppermint study showed improved predictive model performance (Youden's index 95% CI range from 0.69-0.82 to 1.00-1.00) and slightly better reliability of intensity measurements (median RSD from 7% to 5%).
population_specificity: Not specified (participants in a peppermint washout study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review evidence on pharmacological treatments for IBS, including Peppermint oil's impact on IBS symptoms.
results_summary: Peppermint oil demonstrated a positive impact on some symptoms of IBS, though the abstract does not specify the extent or statistical significance of these effects. The study grouped it among other treatments with varying efficacy levels.
population_specificity: Patients with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), though the abstract does not specify subtypes or demographics for Peppermint oil.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to provide an overview of current pharmacological and nonpharmacological treatment options for functional dyspepsia.
results_summary: The abstract does not specifically mention Peppermint or its effects on functional dyspepsia.
population_specificity: Patients with functional dyspepsia (epigastric pain syndrome and postprandial distress syndrome).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of peppermint oil for treating functional abdominal pain disorders (FAPDs) in children.
results_summary: The study found evidence suggesting the benefit of peppermint oil for treating FAPDs in children, though research on efficacy, safety, and optimal dosage remains limited.
population_specificity: Pediatric patients with functional abdominal pain disorders (FAPDs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of peppermint oil as an antispasmodic treatment for acute gastrointestinal cramping pain (GICP) and its potential inclusion in clinical trials.
results_summary: The abstract mentions peppermint oil as one of several antispasmodics undergoing clinical trials, suggesting it may be effective for GICP, but no specific results for peppermint oil are detailed. Fixed-dose combinations of antispasmodics, including peppermint oil, may improve compliance and synergistically reduce GICP.
population_specificity: Not specified (general population with acute GICP).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether peppermint aromatherapy is effective and safe compared to placebo or standard antiemetic treatments for reducing postoperative nausea and vomiting (PONV).
results_summary: The study found no significant effect of peppermint aromatherapy on nausea severity compared to placebo, with low-quality evidence. There were no data reported on nausea duration, rescue antiemetic use, adverse events, or patient satisfaction for peppermint specifically.
population_specificity: Adults and children experiencing postoperative nausea and vomiting.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness of Menthacarin (a peppermint-based treatment) in reducing IBS-associated symptoms in patients with functional dyspepsia (FD).
results_summary: The study found that Menthacarin reduced pain intensity by 50-75% on average in FD patients with IBS-associated symptoms over 28 days, suggesting beneficial effects comparable to those observed in primary FD analyses. The results indicate Menthacarin as a potential treatment option for IBS patients.
population_specificity: FD patients with IBS-associated symptoms (n=111 across 3 RCTs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate peppermint oil as a potential intervention for preventing and reducing enteral tube feeding intolerance (ETFI) in adult populations.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that peppermint oil has bioactive properties with potential benefits for managing adverse gastrointestinal events associated with tube feeding, though specific results are not detailed.
population_specificity: Adults dependent on enteral nutrition.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of medical foods, including peppermint oil, in managing functional gastrointestinal disorders (FGIDs) such as irritable bowel syndrome and functional dyspepsia.
results_summary: The study found that peppermint oil is effective for managing irritable bowel syndrome, with positive effects also observed when combined with caraway seed oil for functional dyspepsia, though robust randomized controlled trials are lacking.
population_specificity: Patients with functional gastrointestinal disorders (FGIDs), including irritable bowel syndrome and functional dyspepsia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically summarize the effectiveness and safety of herbal treatments, including Peppermint, for gastrointestinal disorders in children.
results_summary: The study found promising evidence for the effectiveness of Peppermint in treating gastrointestinal disorders, though results were limited by the small number of studies and specific indications. More rigorous trials are needed to confirm these findings.
population_specificity: Children and adolescents aged 0-18 years with gastrointestinal disorders.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of open-label placebo (OLP) and double-blind placebo (DBP) administration, with a nested RCT comparing DBP and peppermint oil, to understand placebo mechanisms and potential benefits.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results regarding peppermint oil's effects, as the focus is on comparing OLP and DBP administration and exploring genetic, psychological, and experiential dimensions of placebo responses.
population_specificity: Patients with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), chronic low back pain, and episodic migraine.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess and compare the efficacy of a peppermint/caraway-oil combination (Menthacarin) on symptoms and quality of life in patients with functional dyspepsia (FD) consistent with epigastric pain syndrome (EPS) and postprandial distress syndrome (PDS).
results_summary: Menthacarin was superior to placebo in alleviating FD symptoms (P < .001), improving pain and discomfort scores significantly after 2 and 4 weeks. All secondary efficacy measures also favored Menthacarin, demonstrating its effectiveness in improving disease-specific quality of life.
population_specificity: 114 outpatients with chronic or recurrent functional dyspepsia (FD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether orange-peppermint aromatherapy could reduce anxiety in women undergoing image-guided breast biopsy compared to placebo.
results_summary: The study found that lavender-sandalwood aromatherapy significantly reduced anxiety compared to placebo, but orange-peppermint aromatherapy did not show a statistically significant reduction in anxiety.
population_specificity: Women undergoing image-guided breast biopsy.
study_duration: Duration of the biopsy procedure (exact time not specified)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of peppermint oil in treating functional abdominal pain disorders (FAPDs) in children compared to placebo.
results_summary: The study found that peppermint oil showed significant benefit compared to placebo in treating FAPDs in children, based on a single randomized clinical trial. However, the abstract does not provide detailed results on the magnitude or consistency of these effects.
population_specificity: Children with functional abdominal pain disorders (FAPDs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of peppermint oil as a pharmacological approach for managing visceral pain in functional GI diseases, particularly IBS.
results_summary: The abstract mentions peppermint oil as one of the pharmacological approaches for managing visceral pain in IBS, suggesting it is considered effective, but no specific results or statistical data are provided.
population_specificity: Patients with functional GI diseases, principally IBS.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the efficacy and safety of aspirin for acute treatment of episodic tension-type headache (TTH) in adults, including comparisons with peppermint oil as an active comparator.
results_summary: The study found insufficient data to compare aspirin with peppermint oil at any of the tested doses, so no conclusions about peppermint's effects were drawn.
population_specificity: Adults with frequent episodic tension-type headache (TTH).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether placebo-induced relief from nausea could be influenced by instructions and conditioning using a sham peppermint essence vapor.
results_summary: Participants who received positive instructions or conditioning (one pairing of the sham treatment with reduced nausea) reported significantly lower nausea scores compared to those without these interventions, though the interaction between the two factors was not statistically significant.
population_specificity: 56 healthy volunteers

study_goal: To evaluate the efficacy and tolerability of a novel sustained-release peppermint oil formulation in patients with IBS-M and IBS-D.
results_summary: Peppermint oil showed a 40% reduction in IBS symptoms compared to 24.3% with placebo, with significant improvements observed within 24 hours. It was well tolerated with few adverse events.
population_specificity: Patients with IBS-M or IBS-D (mean age 40.7 years, 75% female, 77.8% white).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of peppermint essence as a treatment option for functional bowel disorders, particularly irritable bowel syndrome with constipation and functional constipation.
results_summary: The abstract mentions peppermint essence as one of the available treatment options for functional bowel disorders, suggesting it is considered effective, but specific results or comparative efficacy are not detailed.
population_specificity: Adult patients with constipation and abdominal complaints, including irritable bowel syndrome subtype with constipation and functional constipation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of pharmacologic treatments, including peppermint oil, for children with abdominal pain-related functional gastrointestinal disorders (AP-FGIDs).
results_summary: Peppermint oil showed some evidence of improving symptoms (OR 3.3, 95% CI 0.9-12.0), but the overall quality of evidence was very low. No serious adverse effects were reported.
population_specificity: Children aged 4.5-18 years with AP-FGIDs.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of peppermint oil as part of an integrative approach for managing IBS symptoms.
results_summary: The study found that peppermint oil, among other CAM therapies, improved treatment outcomes in IBS patients, offering symptom relief and enhanced quality of life.
population_specificity: IBS patients

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of peppermint oil as a first-line treatment for abdominal pain in irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).
results_summary: Peppermint oil is considered a first-line treatment for abdominal pain in IBS, with antispasmodic properties that help alleviate symptoms. The abstract suggests it is effective, though specific efficacy data compared to other treatments are not detailed.
population_specificity: Patients with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), particularly those with functional abdominal pain.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether adding peppermint oil to a foot bath could improve pain and anxiety reduction beyond passive relaxation in adolescents with chronic headaches.
results_summary: The study found that while both groups (foot bath alone and foot bath with peppermint oil) reported reduced pain and anxiety, peppermint oil did not significantly enhance these effects compared to the control. The intervention was well tolerated and liked by participants.
population_specificity: Adolescents (mean age 15.2 years, 89% female) diagnosed with primary headache disorders.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the immunomodulatory and antiparasitic effects of peppermint (Mentha x piperita L.) crude leaf extract on murine Schistosomiasis mansoni.
results_summary: Peppermint treatment increased sera levels of IL-10, IFN-γ, IgG2a, and IgE, reduced parasite burden by 35.2%, and significantly decreased egg counts in feces and intestine.
population_specificity: Female Balb/c mice infected with Schistosoma mansoni.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review older and newer treatments for IBS, including alternative therapies like Peppermint.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings about Peppermint's effects on IBS.
population_specificity: Not specified

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential benefits of peppermint oil in managing symptoms of irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).
results_summary: The abstract suggests that peppermint oil may provide benefit for IBS patients, though specific efficacy data or statistical significance is not detailed. It is mentioned alongside other treatments like probiotics, indicating potential but not definitive efficacy.
population_specificity: Patients with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the efficacy and safety of enteric-coated peppermint oil capsules compared with placebo for treating active irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).
results_summary: Peppermint oil was significantly superior to placebo for global improvement of IBS symptoms and abdominal pain, with mild and transient adverse events like heartburn. The study concluded that peppermint oil is a safe and effective short-term treatment for IBS.
population_specificity: Patients with active irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of controlled breathing with peppermint aromatherapy versus controlled breathing alone for relieving postoperative nausea and/or vomiting (PONV).
results_summary: Controlled breathing alone was slightly more effective (62.5%) than peppermint aromatherapy (57.7%), though the difference was not statistically significant. The study concluded that both methods could be used as alternatives to prescribed antiemetics for PONV relief.
population_specificity: Postoperative patients experiencing nausea and/or vomiting.
study_duration: Final assessment occurred 10 minutes post initial treatment, with a possible second treatment at 5 minutes if needed.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the efficacy of peppermint oil in relieving symptoms and improving quality of life in patients with diarrhea-predominant irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).
results_summary: Peppermint oil significantly improved abdominal pain at six weeks compared to placebo, but the effect was transient, as pain scores increased two weeks after treatment ended. Other symptoms and quality of life did not show significant improvement.
population_specificity: Patients with diarrhea-predominant IBS meeting ROME II criteria, excluding those with red flag signs or organic disease.
effective_dosage: Three times daily for six weeks (specific amount not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of peppermint oil in improving symptoms of irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).
results_summary: The study found that peppermint oil appears to improve IBS symptoms, including abdominal pain and altered bowel habits, alongside other treatments like exercise, antibiotics, and probiotics. However, the abstract does not provide specific details on the magnitude of peppermint oil's effects compared to other interventions.
population_specificity: Patients with irritable bowel syndrome, particularly those experiencing abdominal pain and altered bowel habits.

study_goal: The researchers sought to determine whether aromatherapy, including peppermint oil, is effective and safe for treating postoperative nausea and vomiting compared to standard treatments.
results_summary: The study found no reliable evidence supporting the use of peppermint oil for postoperative nausea and vomiting, while isopropyl alcohol showed some effectiveness compared to placebo but was less effective than standard anti-emetic drugs.
population_specificity: Patients experiencing postoperative nausea and vomiting (402 participants across nine studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the taste-masking effects of various methods, including organoleptic masking with sweetener and flavor, on bitter famotidine orally disintegrating tablets (ODTs).
results_summary: The study found that both physical and organoleptic taste-masking methods significantly improved palatability, with the combination of both methods being most effective, achieving scores similar to placebo ODTs. Different taste-masking mechanisms functioned cooperatively to enhance acceptability.
population_specificity: 31 healthy volunteers

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of antispasmodics, including peppermint oil, in treating irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).
results_summary: The study found that peppermint oil, as an antispasmodic, was effective in managing IBS symptoms, supported by systematic reviews and RCTs included in the analysis. However, specific safety data for peppermint oil were not detailed in the abstract.
population_specificity: People with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the dose-dependent peristalsis-suppressing effect of L-menthol (a major constituent of peppermint oil) and determine its recommended dose for upper gastrointestinal endoscopy.
results_summary: L-menthol suppressed gastric peristalsis in a dose-dependent manner, with the effect plateauing at 0.8%. The 0.8% and 1.6% doses showed significantly higher efficacy than placebo, and adverse events were similar across all groups.
population_specificity: 131 patients undergoing upper gastrointestinal endoscopy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether peppermint spirits could effectively reduce postoperative nausea in women after a scheduled C-section compared to placebo and standard antiemetic therapy.
results_summary: Peppermint spirits significantly reduced nausea levels at 2 and 5 minutes post-intervention compared to both the placebo and standard antiemetic groups, suggesting it may be a useful adjunct treatment for postoperative nausea.
population_specificity: Women who underwent a scheduled C-section and experienced postoperative nausea.
effective_dosage: Not specified (inhaled peppermint spirits, exact concentration not mentioned).
study_duration: Immediate effects assessed at 2 and 5 minutes post-intervention.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the acute effects of peppermint oil on intragastric pressure profiles and gastric sensorimotor functions in healthy individuals.
results_summary: Peppermint oil reduced intragastric pressure and proximal stomach motility during fasting but had negligible effects during nutrient intake. It also decreased appetite scores during fasting but did not significantly alter postprandial symptoms or gastric sensitivity.
population_specificity: Healthy volunteers

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of antispasmodics, including peppermint oil, for improving symptoms of irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).
results_summary: Peppermint oil was found to be statistically significantly effective for improving abdominal pain, global assessment, and symptom scores in IBS patients compared to placebo. It was identified as one of the effective antispasmodic subgroups.
population_specificity: Patients with irritable bowel syndrome aged over 12 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of peppermint oil as a first-line therapy for symptom relief in patients with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).
results_summary: The study found that peppermint oil is beneficial as a first-line therapy for some IBS patients, contributing to symptom relief. However, the abstract does not provide detailed efficacy metrics or comparative data.
population_specificity: Patients with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if peppermint oil, as part of a mixed antioxidant oil preparation, could mitigate ozone-induced nasal inflammation and activate antioxidant pathways in the upper respiratory mucosa.
results_summary: The mixed oil preparation, including peppermint, significantly reduced ozone-induced nasal inflammation. However, the specific contribution of peppermint was not isolated, as the study focused on the combined effects of multiple oils.
population_specificity: Healthy human subjects and epithelial cell lines (BEAS-2B and NCI-H23).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether combining peppermint oil with lafutidine enhances the inhibition of gastric acid secretion compared to lafutidine alone.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in intragastric pH between lafutidine alone and lafutidine combined with peppermint oil, indicating peppermint oil did not enhance the acid-suppressing effect of lafutidine.
population_specificity: H. pylori-negative healthy male subjects

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical efficacy of peppermint oil compared to other therapies for irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).
results_summary: The study found that peppermint oil had the highest efficacy among the therapies analyzed, outperforming psychotherapeutic, psychopharmacological, and probiotic interventions. Traditional antispasmodics showed moderate efficacy, while motility-affecting drugs and bran/fiber therapies were ineffective.
population_specificity: Patients with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of peppermint oil in improving symptoms of irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) among Taiwanese patients.
results_summary: Peppermint oil was among several agents found to somewhat improve IBS symptoms, though the abstract does not specify the extent of its efficacy compared to other treatments.
population_specificity: Taiwanese patients with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of various interventions, including peppermint oil, for treating irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).
results_summary: The study found that peppermint oil, as an antispasmodic, was among the interventions reviewed for IBS treatment, but specific efficacy or safety details for peppermint were not highlighted in the abstract.
population_specificity: People with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether enteric-coated, delayed-release peppermint oil (Colpermin) is effective and safe for alleviating symptoms of irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).
results_summary: The study found that Colpermin significantly reduced abdominal pain and discomfort in IBS patients, with 14 out of 90 subjects becoming symptom-free by week 8 compared to 6 in the placebo group. It also improved quality of life with no significant adverse reactions reported.
population_specificity: 90 outpatients with IBS

study_goal: The study aimed to compare the effects of fluoride-containing toothpaste versus a nonfluoridated natural toothpaste (containing peppermint oil) on the mechanical properties of Ni-Ti archwires.
results_summary: The study found that Ni-Ti wires exposed to the nonfluoridated natural toothpaste (containing peppermint oil) showed force degradation similar to fluoride-exposed wires at higher deflections but less degradation at lower deflections. The study did not specifically evaluate peppermint's effects beyond its inclusion in the toothpaste formulation.
population_specificity: Ni-Ti archwires tested under clinical conditions (not human subjects).
effective_dosage: Not specified for peppermint oil (included as part of a nonfluoridated toothpaste formulation).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the efficacy and safety of a 10% menthol solution derived from peppermint for abortive migraine treatment.
results_summary: The menthol solution was statistically superior to placebo in achieving pain-free and pain-relief outcomes at 2 hours and sustained endpoints, and it also alleviated nausea/vomiting and phonophobia/photophobia. No significant difference in adverse effects was observed between the menthol and placebo groups.
population_specificity: 35 patients (80% women, 20% men, mean age 29.6 ± 6.2) with migraine attacks.
effective_dosage: 10% ethanol solution of menthol applied to the forehead and temporal area.
study_duration: The study was conducted from March 2007 to March 2008 (intervention duration per attack not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to optimize rosmarinic acid (RA) extraction from Perilla frutescens and evaluate its potential as an adenosine deaminase (ADA) inhibitor for gout treatment.
results_summary: The study achieved an optimized RA yield of 2.22 mg/g from Perilla, confirmed RA's ADA inhibitory activity (IC50 = 55.11 μM), and demonstrated stable binding through molecular docking and dynamics simulations. The findings support RA as a potential gout treatment compound.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the anti-inflammatory and antioxidant effects of Perilla frutescens leaf-derived extracellular vesicle-like particles (PLEVPs) in treating psoriasis and to identify the underlying mechanisms.
results_summary: PLEVPs significantly alleviated psoriasis symptoms in mouse models by reducing oxidative stress, modulating Treg cells, and promoting keratinocyte apoptosis. The therapeutic effect was linked to the suppression of the IL-17 signaling pathway via the miRNA pab-miR396a-5p.
population_specificity: Mouse models of psoriasis (preventive and therapeutic).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential benefits of probiotics in extending remission duration and reducing symptom burden in ulcerative colitis.
results_summary: The study suggests probiotics may prolong remission and improve clinical symptoms by reducing inflammation markers and restoring intestinal epithelial integrity.
population_specificity: Patients with ulcerative colitis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the latest developments in probiotic encapsulation methods for targeted colorectal cancer (CRC) treatment and evaluate the efficacy and safety of probiotics in CRC prevention and therapy.
results_summary: The study found that single-cell encapsulation techniques can improve probiotic resistance to gastrointestinal conditions, enhance mucosal adhesion, and facilitate targeted release, potentially increasing probiotic effectiveness in CRC treatment. It also highlighted the advantages and disadvantages of current encapsulation technologies and discussed the mechanisms by which probiotics may prevent and treat CRC.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on CRC prevention/treatment)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of probiotics and symbiotics in preventing and treating pediatric infectious diseases, focusing on their interaction with the immune system and identifying knowledge gaps.
results_summary: The study suggests that probiotics and symbiotics may promote a healthy microbiome and improve outcomes in pediatric infectious diseases, but optimal dosages and combinations remain undefined.
population_specificity: Pediatric patients, particularly immunocompromised and critically ill children.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of a multispecies probiotic on emotion regulation and mood in healthy volunteers.
results_summary: The study found clear evidence that probiotics reduce negative mood after two weeks, based on daily monitoring, but few other changes. It also highlighted that pre- versus post-intervention assessments may not reliably detect probiotic-induced emotional changes in healthy subjects.
population_specificity: 88 healthy volunteers
study_duration: Not specified (effects observed starting after two weeks)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential of probiotics to treat atherosclerosis by reducing gut-derived uremic toxins (GDUTs) in circulation.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that probiotics may help reduce GDUTs like TMAO, p-cresyl sulfate, and indoxyl sulfate, which are linked to increased cardiovascular risk and renal decline, but does not provide specific efficacy data.
population_specificity: Patients with atherosclerosis, particularly those with non-traditional risk factors and/or impaired renal function.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the synergistic effects of zinc and indole-3-carbinol (I3C) delivered via a probiotic platform (ZI@EcN) for restoring the intestinal epithelial barrier and regulating gut microbiota in colitis.
results_summary: ZI@EcN effectively restored the epithelial barrier, reduced inflammation, and enriched beneficial gut bacteria while reducing pathogens, demonstrating significant prophylactic and therapeutic efficacy in colitis models. The formulation showed sustained release and targeted delivery in colonic tissues with favorable safety profiles.
population_specificity: Dextran sulfate sodium-induced mouse colitis models.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of dulaglutide alone versus dulaglutide combined with probiotics on cardiovascular risk factors, pancreatic beta-cell function, and gut microbiota in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM).
results_summary: The intervention group (dulaglutide + probiotics) showed greater improvements in glycemic control, inflammatory markers, pancreatic beta-cell function, and gut microbiota composition, along with reduced hypertension and dyslipidemia incidence compared to dulaglutide alone. Both regimens were well-tolerated with no severe adverse effects.
population_specificity: Overweight/obese adults with T2DM (HbA1c 6.5-11%, BMI ≥ 24 kg/m²).
effective_dosage: Probiotics containing Bifidobacterium longum, 2 × 10⁹ CFU/dose daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of probiotic supplementation, including single-strain and multi-strain formulations, on necrotizing enterocolitis (NEC) and related mortality in preterm infants.
results_summary: Probiotics significantly reduced the incidence of NEC (ESRR: 0.51; 95% CI: 0.46, 0.55, p < 0.001) and mortality rate (ESRR: 0.72; 95% CI: 0.68, 0.76, P < 0.001), with multi-strain probiotics showing particular effectiveness.
population_specificity: Preterm neonates (< 37-week gestation)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of probiotics as an adjunct to periodontal therapy on clinical outcomes in patients with gingivitis and periodontitis through a meta-analysis of available evidence.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found that probiotics improved plaque index and bleeding on probing in periodontitis patients, with greater effects in longer follow-up studies. Results for gingivitis were less significant, highlighting the need for further research.
population_specificity: Patients with gingivitis and periodontitis.
study_duration: Varied by study (follow-up periods mentioned but not exact intervention duration)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether probiotics, when used as adjunctive therapy with fluoxetine, could reduce depression severity and influence biomarkers (BDNF, ACTH, cortisol) in patients with major depressive disorder (MDD).
results_summary: The probiotic group showed a significant reduction in depression severity compared to placebo, but no significant changes were observed in cortisol or ACTH levels. BDNF levels increased slightly in the probiotic group, though not statistically significant.
population_specificity: Fifty medication-free MDD patients (44 completed the trial).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential role of Lactobacillus probiotics in preventing and treating sarcopenia via the gut-muscle axis.
results_summary: The study suggests that Lactobacillus probiotics may improve muscle function by reducing inflammation, clearing ROS, enhancing metabolism, and modulating gut microbiota, but the exact mechanisms remain uncertain.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on sarcopenia patients).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the advantages of encapsulating probiotics within liposomes to enhance their stability, survival, and delivery to target sites in the intestines.
results_summary: The study found that liposome encapsulation protects probiotics from environmental and gastrointestinal stressors, promotes their growth and absorption in the intestines, and enhances their stability and bioavailability. It also highlighted structural changes in probiotics and liposomes during digestion and discussed future challenges in the field.
population_specificity: Not specified (general human intestinal health context)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if probiotics could mitigate metabolic disturbances in a PCOS rat model by suppressing the TGF-β1 pathway.
results_summary: Probiotics reversed metabolic and inflammatory abnormalities in PCOS rats, including insulin resistance, hyperinsulinemia, and elevated inflammatory markers, while restoring antioxidant defenses and adipose tissue function.
population_specificity: Female Wistar rats with letrozole-induced PCOS.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of beneficial microorganisms for corals (BMCs) in mitigating short-term acute heat stress in two Red Sea hard coral species.
results_summary: BMC supplementation significantly prevented mortality in Acropora cf. hemprichii at 32°C, improved primary production, and increased algal cell densities and chlorophyll concentrations compared to controls. Pocillopora verrucosa showed no adverse effects in either treatment.
population_specificity: Two Red Sea hard coral species (Acropora cf. hemprichii and Pocillopora verrucosa).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of probiotic supplementation combined with counselling on healthy lifestyle habits on nutritional status and antibody response against SARS-CoV-2 in overweight and obese adolescents.
results_summary: The study protocol was designed to measure changes in body mass index for age z-score, IgG and secretory IgA specific to SARS-CoV-2 titre concentrations, gut microbiota diversity, and Healthy Eating Index scores, but results are not yet reported as the study is ongoing.
population_specificity: Overweight and obese adolescents aged 12-17 living in Jakarta, Surabaya, or Yogyakarta who had completed at least two doses of the COVID-19 vaccine.
effective_dosage: 10^9-10^10 colony-forming units daily of Bifidobacterium animalis subsp. Lactis (BB-12), Lactobacillus acidophilus (LA-5), and Lactobacillus rhamnosus (LGG).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether native probiotics could mitigate oxidative stress in kidney tissues caused by Nickel exposure and enhance protective effects against heavy metal toxicity.
results_summary: The study found that native probiotics upregulated Nrf2-related gene expression before Nickel exposure and significantly restored gene expression levels after Nickel-induced suppression, demonstrating protective antioxidative effects.
population_specificity: Forty male NMRI mice exposed to Nickel.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the current knowledge on probiotic strains, their therapeutic potential for colorectal cancer, limitations, and areas needing further research.
results_summary: Probiotics demonstrated anti-inflammatory and antitumor effects in preclinical and clinical studies, but clinical efficacy evidence is inadequate, requiring more research to establish them as therapeutic agents. Safety is generally recognized, though high-risk patients should exercise caution due to potential infection risks.
population_specificity: General population, with specific mention of high-risk patients (e.g., immunocompromised individuals).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of probiotics combined with pregabalin on seizure activity, behavior, and neuropathology in PTZ-induced epileptic mice.
results_summary: The combination of probiotics and pregabalin significantly reduced seizure activity, improved behavioral outcomes (anxiety, depression, cognition), and provided neuroprotection by reducing oxidative stress and inflammation while enhancing antioxidant activity.
population_specificity: Adult BALB/c mice with PTZ-induced epilepsy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of probiotics on sexual function, hormonal regulation, and reproductive outcomes.
results_summary: Probiotic interventions significantly improved sexual function, particularly in women on antidepressant therapy, and enhanced reproductive outcomes, including higher pregnancy rates and improved sperm parameters. Probiotics also reduced menopausal symptoms and improved hormonal balance.
population_specificity: Women undergoing antidepressant therapy, menopausal women, and individuals undergoing fertility treatments.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of probiotics and metronidazole in treating asymptomatic bacterial vaginosis (aBV) and evaluate their cure and recurrence rates.
results_summary: Probiotics showed higher cumulative cure rates compared to metronidazole, though the differences were not statistically significant. However, probiotics demonstrated significantly lower recurrence rates at follow-up visits, with no severe adverse events reported.
population_specificity: Women with asymptomatic bacterial vaginosis (aBV).
effective_dosage: 10-day intravaginal probiotic capsules (specific dosage not detailed).
study_duration: 10 days for probiotics, 7 days for metronidazole, with follow-ups at 1st, 2nd, and 4th weeks post-therapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically assess the effectiveness of probiotics in treating allergic diseases by integrating results from existing clinical studies.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found that probiotics significantly improve clinical outcomes in patients with allergic diseases, with subgroup analyses showing effectiveness across various conditions and two specific strains being particularly effective. Probiotics can serve as a beneficial adjunctive therapy but should not be the sole treatment method due to the multifactorial nature of allergic diseases.
population_specificity: Pediatric patients with common allergic diseases (food allergies, asthma, allergic rhinitis, or atopic dermatitis).

study_goal: To determine if adding probiotics to metformin and a calorie-restricted diet improves outcomes in obese PCOS patients compared to metformin and diet alone.
results_summary: Probiotics combined with metformin and diet significantly improved hormone levels, insulin resistance, blood sugar, gut microbiota diversity, and BMI reduction compared to metformin and diet alone, though BMI reduction was similar between groups.
population_specificity: Obese patients with polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS) (n=141).
study_duration: June 2021 to December 2023 (retrospective analysis, exact intervention duration unclear)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether engineered Escherichia coli Nissle 1917 (EcN) loaded with CO/H2S-releasing copolymer (POSR) could effectively target gut delivery of gasotransmitters to alleviate IBD symptoms and associated anxiety/depression.
results_summary: The engineered probiotic (POSR@EcN) enhanced intestinal colonization, reduced inflammation, restored gut barrier integrity, reshaped microbiota, and alleviated IBD symptoms. It also increased neuroprotective metabolites, reducing neuroinflammation and anxiety/depression-like behaviors in IBD mice.
population_specificity: IBD mice (animal model)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of probiotics, prebiotics, and synbiotics on heavy metal exposure and related health outcomes in human clinical trials.
results_summary: Probiotics combined with zinc improved resolution times for vomiting and diarrhea, enhanced treatment efficacy for antibiotic-associated diarrhea, and reduced hospital stays. Prebiotics improved iron absorption in women and children, while probiotics did not significantly affect blood parameters or H. pylori eradication rates but reduced side effects like diarrhea and vomiting.
population_specificity: Human participants, including pregnant women and children.
effective_dosage: Probiotic doses ranged from 10^7 to 2.5 × 10^10 CFU/day.
interactions: Reduced side effects when combined with bismuth quadruple therapy; no other interactions mentioned.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential role of probiotics in influencing oral cancer development, progression, and metastasis, particularly in oral squamous cell carcinoma (OSCC).
results_summary: The study suggests that probiotics may have direct or indirect positive effects on oral cancer by modulating the oral microbiome, immune signaling pathways, and other cellular processes, though specific clinical outcomes are not detailed.
population_specificity: General discussion of oral cancer (OSCC) and microbiome interactions, no specific human or animal population detailed.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the role of small intestine microbiota, particularly Lactobacillus johnsonii-derived extracellular vesicles (EVs), in modulating bile acid metabolism and their potential impact on Alzheimer's disease pathology.
results_summary: The study found that L. johnsonii-derived EVs inhibited the growth of Clostridium scindens and suppressed toxic secondary lithocholic acid (TLA) production, suggesting a potential therapeutic role in mitigating AD-related bile acid dysregulation. Small RNA removal from EVs abolished their TLA-suppressing effects.
population_specificity: APPNL-G-F/NL-G-F transgenic mice (a model for Alzheimer's disease).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of rifaximin combined with probiotics versus rifaximin monotherapy in treating irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).
results_summary: The combination therapy showed significantly higher responder rates for IBS severity and quality of life scores compared to monotherapy at weeks 4 and 8, demonstrating superior efficacy. The study concluded that the combination is effective and safe for IBS patients.
population_specificity: Patients with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of a specific probiotic mixture in shortening fever duration among children with upper respiratory tract infections (URTIs).
results_summary: The probiotic mixture reduced fever duration by 2 days compared to placebo, with no significant difference in mild adverse events between groups. The study concluded that the probiotic could be an effective adjuvant for shortening fever in children with URTIs.
population_specificity: Children aged 28 days to 4 years with fever (≥38.5 °C) and URTI, excluding those with recent probiotic use, chronic autoimmune diseases, immunosuppressive treatment, or hospitalization needs.
effective_dosage: 0.5 mL daily probiotic mixture containing Bifidobacterium breve M-16V, Bifidobacterium lactis HN019, and Lactobacillus rhamnosus HN001.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of a probiotic complex on IBS symptoms in mice by modulating gut microbiota and fecal metabolites.
results_summary: The probiotic relieved constipation, reduced inflammation and intestinal permeability, lowered 5-HT levels, and increased SERT expression. Metagenomic analysis showed reduced inflammation-related species abundance and decreased fecal butyric acid, acetic acid, and tryptophan levels.
population_specificity: IBS-induced mice

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of probiotic and postbiotic cocktails on kidney health by modulating the autophagy signaling pathway in a colitis-induced mouse model.
results_summary: Both probiotic and postbiotic treatments reduced colitis-associated indicators and upregulated autophagy-related genes in the kidney, with postbiotics showing greater efficacy. The study suggests these treatments may mitigate gut and kidney inflammation via the gut-kidney axis.
population_specificity: Mice with dextran sulfate sodium-induced colitis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of probiotics in restoring gut-liver axis balance and modulating lipid metabolism to alleviate hyperlipidemia.
results_summary: The study suggests probiotics may help alleviate hyperlipidemia by altering gut microbiota composition and regulating lipid metabolism via the gut-liver axis, though more clinical trials are needed to confirm these effects.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion of hyperlipidemia and gut-liver axis mechanisms).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if probiotics could ameliorate hypothalamic amenorrhea in a PCOS rat model by modulating hypothalamic kisspeptin and reducing inflammation.
results_summary: Probiotics reversed pathological alterations in PCOS rats, including improved insulin sensitivity, reduced inflammation, restored antioxidant levels, and enhanced hypothalamic kisspeptin, leading to amelioration of hypothalamic amenorrhea.
population_specificity: Female Wistar rats with letrozole-induced PCOS.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of vaginal probiotic supplementation before embryo transfer on pregnancy rates.
results_summary: Vaginal probiotics showed a non-significant increase in clinical pregnancy rates and a slight non-significant reduction in miscarriage risk, with no significant differences in biochemical or ongoing pregnancy rates.
population_specificity: Women undergoing embryo transfer, including those with and without a history of recurrent implantation failure.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a safe and effective probiotic system (ECA@EcN) for inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) therapy by enhancing antioxidant performance and microbiota balance.
results_summary: The ECA@EcN system effectively scavenged reactive oxygen species (ROS), improved probiotic viability, promoted colon accumulation, alleviated inflammation, and modulated intestinal microbial communities to relieve IBD symptoms.
population_specificity: Not specified (likely preclinical or animal model based on abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compile data from clinical trials to determine whether probiotics could prevent or treat perioperative neurocognitive disorders (PND) by influencing the microbiota-gut-brain axis.
results_summary: The study suggests that probiotics may help restore gut flora disrupted by anesthesia and surgery, potentially reducing neuroinflammation and PND. Evidence indicates probiotics have immunomodulatory and anti-inflammatory benefits, though clinical application requires further validation.
population_specificity: Elderly individuals undergoing surgery and anesthesia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential of gerobiotics (selective probiotics, postbiotics, and parabiotics) in modulating aging processes, enhancing systemic health, and reducing risks of age-related chronic conditions.
results_summary: The review highlights gerobiotics' promise in targeting aging hallmarks and regulating longevity-associated pathways, but notes challenges such as formulation optimization, safety, efficacy across diverse populations, and clinical translation.
population_specificity: Not specified (general aging population implied).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate and compare the effectiveness of different synbiotic combinations, particularly focusing on their ability to limit metabolic dysfunction-associated steatotic liver disease progression.
results_summary: The FOS+Pro synbiotic combination showed superior protection against liver degeneration, reducing body weight, liver weight, inflammation markers, and improving lipid metabolism. It also significantly lowered serum AST and cholesterol levels.
population_specificity: Not specified (likely animal model based on "western diet-induced" context).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of oral nutritional supplementation combined with probiotics on liver function and intestinal microflora in lung cancer chemotherapy patients.
results_summary: The intervention group showed significant improvements in liver function (ALT, AST) and gut microbiota compared to the placebo group, but no notable changes in nutrition, immune status, or blood lipids were observed.
population_specificity: 113 lung cancer patients undergoing chemotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of specific lactic acid bacteria (LAB) probiotics, isolated from Chinese baijiu, on preventing drunkenness, sobering up, and protecting against alcohol-induced liver injury.
results_summary: The study found that the LAB strains (Lactiplantibacillus pentosus LTJ12, Pediococcus acidilactici LTJ28, Lactiplantibacillus plantarum LTJ30, and Pediococcus acidilactici LTJ32) reduced drunkenness, shortened sobriety time, lowered ethanol levels in serum, improved liver enzyme activity, and reversed alcohol-induced metabolic and inflammatory changes. The probiotics also restored gut microbiota balance and regulated short-chain fatty acid content.
population_specificity: Drinking mice (animal study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether native probiotic strains could modulate inflammatory and autophagy signaling pathways to mitigate nickel-induced oxidative stress and neuroinflammation via the gut-brain axis.
results_summary: The probiotic cocktail significantly increased the expression of autophagy-related genes compared to the control group, indicating activation of autophagy pathways and reduced neuroinflammation in response to nickel exposure.
population_specificity: Twenty male NMRI mice divided into 4 groups.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical efficacy of probiotics combined with mesalazine and Yiyi Baitouweng Decoction retention enema in treating mild-to-moderate ulcerative colitis.
results_summary: The study found that the combination treatment (probiotics, mesalazine, and Yiyi Baitouweng Decoction) improved clinical efficacy, reduced colonoscopy scores and inflammatory markers (TNF-α, IFN-γ, CRP, ESR), and increased anti-inflammatory IL-10 levels compared to mesalazine alone.
population_specificity: 86 mild-to-moderate ulcerative colitis patients.
effective_dosage: Not specified (Bifidobacterium Tetravaccine Tablets and Yiyi Baitouweng Decoction retention enema used alongside mesalazine).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop an engineered probiotic (LH@LA) to reduce L-lactate levels in tumors, improve the immunosuppressive tumor microenvironment, and inhibit tumor growth.
results_summary: The engineered Lactobacillus acidophilus (LH@LA) successfully reduced L-lactate levels via an enzyme cascade reaction, reversed AKT-mTOR pathway activation to inhibit tumor growth, and induced anti-inflammatory M2 macrophages to polarize into pro-inflammatory M1 macrophages, enhancing antitumor immunotherapy.
population_specificity: Tumor microenvironment (preclinical study, not human subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to isolate and evaluate oxalate-degrading, cholesterol-lowering, and anti-adipogenic lactic acid bacteria (LAB) strains from raw donkey's milk and homemade fermented pickles for potential therapeutic use in metabolic syndrome.
results_summary: Nine LAB strains showed in vitro oxalate-degrading, α-glucosidase inhibiting, and cholesterol-lowering activities, with four strains significantly reducing lipid storage by limiting adipogenesis and lipogenesis in murine 3T3-L1 adipocytes. The effective isolates demonstrated good survivability under gastric conditions and non-haemolytic activity.
population_specificity: Murine 3T3-L1 adipocytes (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of a probiotic blend combined with an oral nutritional supplement on microbiota, intestinal permeability, and depression symptoms in malnourished hemodialysis patients.
results_summary: The probiotic blend maintained LPS levels, decreased BDNF levels, reduced depressive symptoms (HADS-D), and improved quality of life (SF12-MH). It also altered microbiome composition, reducing Akkermansia and increasing Barnesiella abundance.
population_specificity: Malnourished individuals undergoing hemodialysis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the therapeutic mechanisms and potential of probiotics in breast cancer treatment, focusing on their immunomodulatory and anticancer properties.
results_summary: The review highlights probiotics' ability to enhance cancer therapies, minimize side effects, and modulate the tumor microenvironment through metabolic, immune, and molecular mechanisms. Clinical studies show promise but also reveal limitations in translating preclinical findings to clinical practice.
population_specificity: Breast cancer patients

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of single- and multi-strain probiotics, alone or combined with gentamicin, as a therapeutic strategy for E. coli O157:H7 infections.
results_summary: Multi-strain probiotics (P2) alone or combined with gentamicin showed superior efficacy, achieving 100% survival, no pathological symptoms, and full weight recovery in mice, while single-strain probiotics (P1) had lower survival rates and slower recovery. P2 also demonstrated better kidney function and tissue recovery compared to P1 and gentamicin combinations.
population_specificity: Mice infected with E. coli O157:H7.
interactions: Gentamicin (nephrotoxicity noted when combined with probiotics).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether probiotics, combined with healthy lifestyle habits, contribute to weight reduction and improvements in physiological parameters in obese individuals by analyzing changes in intestinal microbiota.
results_summary: The study found that probiotics, alongside lifestyle changes, led to reductions in BMI, fasting glucose, insulin, HOMA-IR, LDL cholesterol, and triglycerides, as well as increased HDL cholesterol, improved bowel movement frequency, and stool consistency. Additionally, microbial diversity increased, and a better balance between Firmicutes and Bacteroidetes was observed.
population_specificity: 45 adults with obesity

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether oral probiotics could reduce body weight, waist circumference, and visceral fat content in obese individuals through a meta-analysis of randomized controlled trials.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found that probiotics significantly reduced weight loss, waist circumference, and visceral fat content in obese patients compared to controls, but showed no significant effect on BMI or LDL-C levels.
population_specificity: Obese individuals (412 patients across 8 randomized controlled trials).
